I 'll turn them out myself .The SAIS goes in and turns out all the lights in the lower rooms but one . The light remains now only just round ARTHUR and VIOLET . The Arab song is like a wail of pain .That sounds strangely after the waltzes and one-steps that we 've heard this evening .

sp.speaker: VIOLET
sp.p: It seems to come from very far away .

sp.speaker: ARTHUR
sp.p: It seems to wail down the ages from an immeasurable past .

sp.speaker: VIOLET
sp.p: What does it say ?

sp.speaker: ARTHUR
sp.p: I do n't know . It must be some old lament .

sp.speaker: VIOLET
sp.p: It 's heartrending .

sp.speaker: ARTHUR
sp.p: Now it stops .

sp.speaker: VIOLET
sp.p: The garden is so silent . It seems to be listening too .

sp.speaker: ARTHUR
sp.p: Are you awfully unhappy , Violet ?

sp.speaker: VIOLET
sp.p: Awfully .

sp.speaker: ARTHUR
sp.p: It breaks my heart that I , who would do anything in the world for you , can do so little to console you .

sp.speaker: VIOLET
sp.p: Had you any idea that Ronny no longer cared for me ?

sp.speaker: ARTHUR
sp.p: How should I know what his feelings were ?

sp.speaker: VIOLET
sp.p: It never occurred to me that he could change . I felt so secure in his love . It never occurred to me that anyone could take him from me .

sp.speaker: ARTHUR
sp.p: Did he tell you he did n't care for you any more ?

sp.speaker: VIOLET
sp.p: No .

sp.speaker: ARTHUR
sp.p: I do n't think he 's in love with Miss Pender .

sp.speaker: VIOLET
sp.p: I told him that he meant nothing to me any more . I told him that I took fancies and got over them . I made him think I was a silly flirt . And he believed me . If he loved me truly , truly , as he did before , whatever I 'd said he 'd have known it was incredible . Oh , I would n't have believed him if he 'd made himself cheap in my eyes .

sp.speaker: ARTHUR
sp.p: My poor child .

sp.speaker: VIOLET
sp.p: He 's not in love with her yet . I know that . He 's only pleased and flattered . He 's angry with me . If he 's angry he must love me still . He asked so little . It only needed a word and he would have loved me as much as ever . What have I done ? What harm would it have done you ? I 've sent him away now for good . It 's all over and done with . And my heart aches . What shall I do , Arthur ?

sp.speaker: ARTHUR
sp.p: My dear , have courage . I beseech you to have courage .

sp.speaker: VIOLET
sp.p: I suppose it 's shameful that we should have loved one another at all . But how could we help it ? We 're masters of our actions , but how can we command our feelings ? After all , our feelings are our own . I do n't know what I 'm going to do , Arthur . It was n't so bad till to-night ; I could control myself , I thought my pain was growing less .... I long for him with all my soul , and I must let him go . Oh , I hate him . I hate him . If he 'd loved me he might have been faithful to me a few short weeks . He would n't cause me such cruel pain .

sp.speaker: ARTHUR
sp.p: Do n't be unjust to him , Violet . I think he fell in love with you without knowing what was happening to him . And when he knew I think he struggled against it as honourably as you did . You know that very little escapes me . I 've seen a sort of shyness in him when he was with me , as though he were a little ashamed in my presence . I even felt sorry for him because he felt he was behaving badly to me and he could n't help himself . He 's suffered just as much as you have . It 's not very strange that when this girl fell in love with him it should seem to offer a new hope . He was unhappy and she comforted him . Anne says she 's rather like you . If ever he loves her perhaps it will be you that he loves in her .

sp.speaker: VIOLET
sp.p: Why do you say all this to me ?

sp.speaker: ARTHUR
sp.p: You 've been so wretched . I do n't want bitterness to come to you now . I can n't bear that you should think your first love has been for someone not worthy of it . I think time will heal the wounds which now you think are incurable , but when it does I hope that you will look back on your love as a thing only of beauty .

sp.speaker: VIOLET
sp.p: I am a beast , Arthur . I do n't deserve anyone to be so good to me as you are .

sp.speaker: ARTHUR
sp.p: And there 's something else I must tell you .... It appears that various enterprising people have been laying plans to put me out of the way .

sp.speaker: VIOLET
sp.p: Startled .Arthur !

sp.speaker: ARTHUR
sp.p: I find that there was a plot to kill me this morning on my way to the review .

sp.speaker: VIOLET
sp.p: How awful !

sp.speaker: ARTHUR
sp.p: Oh , it 's nothing to be alarmed about . We 've settled everything without any fuss . Our old friend Osman Pasha is going to spend some time on his country estates for the good of his health , and half a dozen foolish young men are under lock and key . But it might have come off except for Ronny . It was Ronny who saved me .

sp.speaker: VIOLET
sp.p: Ronny ? Oh , I 'm so glad . It makes up a little for the rest .

sp.speaker: ARTHUR
sp.p: He did a fine thing . He showed determination and presence of mind .

sp.speaker: VIOLET
sp.p: Oh , my husband ! My dear , dear Arthur !

sp.speaker: ARTHUR
sp.p: You 're not sorry ?

sp.speaker: VIOLET
sp.p: I 'm glad I 've done what I have , Arthur . I 've sometimes felt I gave you so little in return for all you 've given me . But at least now I 've given you all I had to give .

sp.speaker: ARTHUR
sp.p: Do n't think it will be profitless . To do one 's duty sounds a rather cold and cheerless business , but somehow in the end it does give one a queer sort of satisfaction .

sp.speaker: VIOLET
sp.p: What should I do if I lost you ? It makes me sick with fear .

sp.speaker: ARTHUR
sp.p: With a tender smile .I had an idea you 'd be glad I escaped .

sp.speaker: VIOLET
sp.p: All I 've suffered has been worth while . I 've done something for you , have n't I ? And even something for England ... I 'm so tired .

sp.speaker: ARTHUR
sp.p: Why do n't you go to bed , darling ?

sp.speaker: VIOLET
sp.p: No , I do n't want to go yet . I 'm too tired . Let me stay here a little longer .

sp.speaker: ARTHUR
sp.p: Put your feet up .

sp.speaker: VIOLET
sp.p: Come and sit close to me , Arthur . I want to be comforted . You 're so good and kind to me , Arthur . I 'm so glad I have you . You will never fail me .

sp.speaker: ARTHUR
sp.p: Never .She gives a little shudder .What 's the matter ?

sp.speaker: VIOLET
sp.p: I hope he 'll marry her quickly . I want to be a good wife to you . I want your love . I want your love so badly .

sp.speaker: ARTHUR
sp.p: My dear one .

sp.speaker: VIOLET
sp.p: Put your arms round me . I 'm so tired .

sp.speaker: ARTHUR
sp.p: You 're half asleep .... Are you asleep ?

div.stage: Her eyes are closed . He kisses her gently . In the distance there is heard again the melancholy wail of a Bedouin love-song .
